title: Etihad Stadium fire live updates as blaze breaks ahead of Man City Champions League tie
body_text:
A fire has broken out outside the Etihad Stadium in Manchester this evening (Wednesday, January 29). Footage and pictures taken online show the blaze close to a merchandise stand with huge crowds of fans watching on.
Both fire engines and emergency crews can be seen in attendance, reports Manchester Evening News. The blaze has broken out just hours before the UEFA Champions League match against Club Brugge.
Details around how the blaze started has not yet been confirmed. The Greater Manchester Fire and Rescue Service have been contacted for details.
This is a breaking incident. Updates to follow.
Key Events
Game still expected to kick off at 8pm
The game is still expected to kick off at the planned time of 8pm
Manchester City FC will take on Club Brugge in the UEFA Champions League match this evening.
New images from scene show scorched merchandise kiosk
Fire crews remain at the scene of the earlier fire this evening
More pictures from earlier this evening
More images taken earlier tonight show the moment the dramatic fire erupted
Merchandise stall left in tatters after being ravaged by fire
The merchandise stall outside the Etihad stadium this evening has been left in tatters after being ravaged by the fire.
The blaze erupted shorlty before 6pm tonight, with emergency services rushing to the area as crowds of fans were moved away.
The fire was quickly brought under control and put out by crews - with pictures now showing the damage caused to the kiosk.
Smoke seen for MILES over Etihad stadium after fire erupts
Clouds of smoke could be seen for miles after the fire erupted at the Etihad stadium this evening.
Pictures taken showing the skyline this evening showed how smoke could be seen filling the sky and billowing over the stadium grounds.
Arrival of first team bus cancelled
Manchester City FC writer Joe Bray said: "City have cancelled the planned arrival of the first team bus at the normal West Reception due to the fire outside and it has gone into the stadium through the tunnel under the stadium."
Pictures from the scene earlier tonight
Pictures from the scene earlier tonight show how the fire erupted at a merchandise stand.
The portable kiosk caught fire shortly before 6pm.
Smoke fills area as fire crews tackle blaze
It looks like it a City merchandise kiosk that had the issue pic.twitter.com/ANYqcwQ5Wo

Team takes different entry into stadium
Fire crews are still in attendance near the West reception
The team bus has taken a different entry to the stadium as firefighters are still busy near West Reception pic.twitter.com/Aqef3LDfmh
— Simon Bajkowski (@spbajko) January 29, 2025
City issues statement on merchandise kiosk blaze
A post shared by Manchester City read: "Manchester City FC can confirm that there has been a fire in one of the outside merchandise kiosks, located near the entrance to the Colin Bell West Stand.
" Emergency services are present at the scene and the fire has now been extinguished. The safety of all attending the match tonight is our top priority, and as such all events planned for West Stand reception have been cancelled, including the welcome event for new players, and the first team arrival."
Three gates closed due to fire
A message over the loudspeaker at the Etihad said: “The stadium is normal. Please enter the stadium as normal. However gates V, X and Y are closed this evening.
"Anyone from Gate Y to use Gate B and V or X to await further instructions. The area where the fire was is still closed off"
Fire service issue statement on blaze at Etihad 'outbuilding'
A spokesperson for Greater Manchester Fire and Rescue Service (GMFRS) said: “Just before 6pm this evening (Wednesday 29th January), two fire engines from Blackley and Philips Park fire station were called to reports of a building fire involving an outbuilding on the car park of the football ground on Rowsley Street, Manchester.
“Crews arrived quickly at the scene. Firefighters wearing breathing apparatus used two hose reels to extinguish the fire, they are currently dampening down any hotspots and making the area safe.
“Firefighters have been in attendance for around twenty minutes and are still at the scene.”
Moment huge fire erupts outside stadium
Video footage posted online has shown the moment huge flames were seen erupting outside the stadium this evening.
Emergency crews descended on the area shortly before 6pm.
Fire broke out at merchandise stand
The blaze this evening is thought to have broken out at one of the merchandise stands around the perimeter of the stadium.
It was situated outside the West Stand reception.
Multiple fire engines arrived on blue lights earlier this evening, with crowds in their hundreds being moved away from the area.
The cause of the blaze has not yet been confirmed.
WATCH: Dramatic video shows crowds watching on as stand bursts into flames
Dramatic video footage shared on social media shows crowds watching on as the fire erupted earlier tonight.
It is thought to have started outside the stadium at a merchandise stand.
Fuego en las afueras del Etihad Stadium pic.twitter.com/XGMoZJPKKW

Crowds of fans are being held back
Crowds are being held back around 100 feet away from the fire this evening.
Thousands are gathered outside the stadium ahead of kick off at 8pm this evening.
The blaze erupted outside the stadium before new signings Marmous, Khusanov and Reis were about to be unveiled to fans.
